column2: MINNESOTA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change from green to red.

column2: 2. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.
column6: passing is allowed for both drivers.
column8: passing is allowed during daylight only.

column2: 3. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column8: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column10: Immediately come to a complete stop

column2: 4. Drivers may pass on a two-lane roadway marked with a single solid yellow line on their side of the center line.
5. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column8: Eating food

column2: 6. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column6: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column8: wait for the next green light.
column10: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 7. Regulatory signs are:
column8: Suggestions

column2: 8. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.

column2: 9. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column8: have your emergency brake on.

column2: 10. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.
column6: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column8: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column10: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column8: the road may be slippery when wet.
column10: no turns are allowed on this road.

column2: 12. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column8: whoever is slower

column2: 13. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 14. This sign is a:
column8: guide sign.

column2: 15. Worn tires:
column8: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.

column2: 16. Roads are most slippery:
column8: when it stops raining.
column10: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 17. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.

column2: 18. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column8: on an up-hill.

column2: 19. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column8: Marijuana.

column2: 20. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column8: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 21. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column6: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column8: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column10: get off the highway as quickly as possible.

column2: 22. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column8: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 23. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column8: Crossbuck

column2: 24. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 25. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column8: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column10: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.

column2: 26. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column2: 27. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 28. Who is most at risk?
column8: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 29. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: drive in the right lane only.
column6: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column8: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: sound their horn to warn other drivers.

column2: 30. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column4: at the center of the road
column6: to the left of the road
column8: straight ahead
column10: to the right of the road

column2: 31. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column8: Warning signs

column2: 32. Parking is not allowed:
column8: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 33. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: others drive below the speed limit.
column6: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column8: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column10: you are on a four lane road.

column2: 34. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column6: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.
column8: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.

column2: 35. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column2: 36. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 37. Which shape is a stop sign?
column8: Upside-down triangle

column2: 38. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column6: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
column8: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.

column2: 39. A common mistake that drivers make is driving without adequate rest.
40. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.
column8: a yield sign.
